intro: Merxmuellera papposa, commonly known as the hairy merxmuellera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, pale flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
